Issues.Title: 当keep-alive的页面在某种情况下调用了$destroy后，再次进入这个页面，这个页面也不会再被缓存
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.22

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/llo55mv08q](https://codesandbox.io/s/llo55mv08q)







### Steps to reproduce
1、打开页面
2、在输入框内输入一些字符串
3、点击 click to next page 跳转到下一页
4、点击 click go back 返回前一页
5、可以看见输入框内的文字是之前输入的内容
6、点击 click to next page and $destroy this page
7、点击 click go back 
8、此时由于之前页面被释放，所以输入框内的文字恢复到默认状态
9、再次在输入框内输入一些文字
10、点击 click to next page
11、点击 click go back
12、此时回到页面后发现页面并没有被缓存下来，输入框内的文字恢复到默认状态

### What is expected?
期望第12步的时候页面被缓存了下来

### What is actually happening?
未缓存

---
问题导致的原因是：当页面调用$destroy后，这个页面从此就再也不会被keep-alive了，有什么办法能恢复keep-alive的效果？

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "当keep-alive的页面在某种情况下调用了$destroy后，再次进入这个页面，这个页面也不会再被缓存" (#9952)

So basically alert 1, then 2. But the parent alerts first, so it does 2, then 1. How can I get the child to mount first? Thanks ### What is expected? Issues.Title: Vue.js parses <noscript> tag and whatever is inside it.
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.10

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/timbenniks/pen/yPOLej](https://codepen.io/timbenniks/pen/yPOLej)







### Steps to reproduce
* Add a _noscript_ tag inside the DOM node that is given to the Vue constructor. 
* In that _noscript_ tag, add an image tag. 
* Open the network tab of the developer tools.
* Load the page.

### What is expected?
The expected result would be that Vue.js ignores whatever is found in the _noscript_ tag.

### What is actually happening?
That is actually happening: observe that Vue.js loads the image inside the _noscript_ tag. Hence, Vue.js parses the _noscript_ tag and whatever is found within it.

---
We found this issue as we are using Vue.js not in SPA mode but sprinkling it on top of existing HTML. When turning off the JS the page still renders HTML. The goal is to have lazy loading images and without JS we still want to see the images. Hence an image tag in a _noscript_ element.

This sounds like an edge case but in fact this is common usage for big e-commerce systems and cms' like Sitecore and Adobe AEM.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue.js parses <noscript> tag and whatever is inside it." (#9949)

Issues.Title: Infinite loop when using dynamic import to lazy load component inside the root render function
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.10

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/unlocomqx/vue-loop-reproduction](https://github.com/unlocomqx/vue-loop-reproduction)







### Steps to reproduce
- npm install
- npm run serve
- open http://localhost:8080
- the tab should freeze because of the infinite loop


### What is expected?
The list component should be injected in #list showing List 123

### What is actually happening?
The tab freezes and mem consumption increases continually

```
  // this works fine
  let factory = () => import(`@/components/async/List.vue`);
  new Vue({
    store,
    render: h => h(factory),
    el: `#list`,
  });

  // this get caught in infinite loop
  new Vue({
    store,
    render: h => h(() => import(`@/components/async/List.vue`)),
    el: `#list`,
  });
```

---
When using a variable to store the import function, the code works fine but when using the import function directly in the render function, the code bugs

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Infinite loop when using dynamic import to lazy load component inside the root render function" (#9943)

Issues.Title: Typing: Props not bound to `this`
Issues.Body:
### Version
Vue: 2.6.10
TS: 3.3.4000 and 3.4.5

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/octref/vue-prop-type-error](https://github.com/octref/vue-prop-type-error)

### Steps to reproduce
- `git clone https://github.com/octref/vue-prop-type-error && cd vue-prop-type-error` 
- `yarn`
- `yarn compile`

### What is expected?
No error reported from this file

```ts
import Vue from 'vue'

const foo = Vue.extend({
  props: {
    a: Array,
    s: String,
    b: Boolean
  },
  created() {
    console.log(this.a)
    console.log(this.s)
    console.log(this.b)
  }
})
```

### What is actually happening?

`a`, `s`, `b` are not bound to this instance

```
index.ts:10:22 - error TS2339: Property 'a' does not exist on type 'ComponentOptions<Vue, DefaultDat
a<Vue>, DefaultMethods<Vue>, DefaultComputed, PropsDefinition<Record<string, any>>, Record<string, a
ny>>'.

10     console.log(this.a)
                        ~

index.ts:11:22 - error TS2339: Property 's' does not exist on type 'ComponentOptions<Vue, DefaultDat
a<Vue>, DefaultMethods<Vue>, DefaultComputed, PropsDefinition<Record<string, any>>, Record<string, a
ny>>'.

11     console.log(this.s)
                        ~

index.ts:12:22 - error TS2339: Property 'b' does not exist on type 'ComponentOptions<Vue, DefaultDat
a<Vue>, DefaultMethods<Vue>, DefaultComputed, PropsDefinition<Record<string, any>>, Record<string, any>>'.

12     console.log(this.b)
                        ~


Found 3 errors.
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Typing: Props not bound to `this`" (#9935)

Issues.Title: Number Input Does Not Accept Decimals While Using Firefox
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.10

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/618c7pe5/](https://jsfiddle.net/618c7pe5/)







### Steps to reproduce

Issues.Title: Prevent `$route` updating deactivated components when using keep-alive
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
When wrapping `router-view` inside `keep-alive`, the components which are kept alive, keep updating on every route change, if they depend on any `$route` properties like `$route.name` or `$route.params`.

This kinda defeats the purpose of keep-alive, because even though kept-alive components are not remounted, they update in every route change, even while they are deactivated.



### What does the proposed API look like?
The default behavior should be that $route only causes the component to update if the component has been activated.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Is it possible to bring parameters outside the url when jumping routes?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
When the react router jumps the route, in addition to taking the parameter to the url, it can also be placed in the state.

Reference https://reacttraining.com/react-router/web/api/location

The characteristic of this parameter is that even if the page is refreshed, it still works, even if it is not on the url.
But when the url is shared, this parameter will not be taken.
Such parameters are only useful in the current session.

### What does the proposed API look like?
like this

```
push({
   path: '',
   query: {},
   params: {},
   state: {},
})
```

Issues.Title: Properly encode/decode the percentage character (% -> %25) across browser and upon initial navigation
Issues.Body:
Currently, the percentage character creates multiple issues and inconsistencies. This is partly due to: - the `%` is forbidden as part of the pathname in the URL per its spec (https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#path-state) if not escaped - IE allows it because it follows a different spec (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-2.4) In Vue router, we have multiple inconsistencies between asterisk path, param paths and regular path regarding escaping these characters and whether the navigation is initial or triggered by a push/router-link Given this set of routes in history mode ```js [ { path: '/foo/:p', component: Foo }, { path: '*', component: Other, }, ] ``` ## History mode / Chrome, IE 11,10 | `to` | route match | href produced in router-link | `$router` info after clicking | `$router` info on direct navigation | remarks | | ---------- | ----------- | ---------------------------- | ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | `/%7D` | `*` | `/%7D` | `/%7D` - `/}` | `/}` - `/}` | User should write `/}` as the link instead | | `/}` | `*` | `/%7D` | `/}` - `/}` | N/A (browser should encode it te be `/%7D`) | - | | `/%25` | `*` | `/%25` | `/%25` - `/%` | ERROR | Navigation should be possible. Should user also write `/%` to be consistent? | | `/%` | `*` | ERROR | N/A (not working) | N/A (not valid) | Or should they escape the percent themselves because it's the only special character | | `/foo/%7D` | `/foo/:p` | `/%7D` | `/%7D` - p = `}` | `/}` - p = `}` | User should write `/foo/}` | | `/foo/}` | `/foo/:p` | `/%7D` | `/}` - p = `}` | `/}` - p = `}` | | `/foo/%25` | `/foo/:p` | `/%25` | `/%25` - p = `%` | ERROR | Navigation should be possible | ## Hash mode / TODO ## Query / TODO --- Complete html file to test. Requires a `vue-router.js` file in the same folder `index.html` ```html Document 
{{ $route.path }}
{{ $route.params }}
/home /%7D /} /%25 /foo/%7D /foo/} /foo/%25
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Properly encode/decode the percentage character (% -> %25) across browser and upon initial navigation" (#2725)

Issues.Title: makeLocalGetters performance hit on ssr
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.1.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/frankcs/pen/NmOLNX](https://codepen.io/frankcs/pen/NmOLNX)







### Steps to reproduce
Using vuex on ssr following the ssr guide. I have created an application with a large number of components and modules and therefore a large number of namespaced getters. Every time such a getter is invoked the makeLocalGetters function is called iterating trough all the getters in the store just to create the gettersProxy object. This is overkill for ssr performance and is being flagged as a CPU consuming process in the node profiler. 
I have managed to double the number of requests per second my ssr app can handle just by using memoization on the gettersProxy object creation. I think this is really impacting performance.

### What is expected?
Namespaced getters invokation not to be inefficient with large numbers of getters/modules

### What is actually happening?
A lot of hits to makeLocalGetters making performance go down

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
